comment.author: 39967544@N00
comment._content: The ship is the Orient S N Co liner Ormonde, built in 1917 and in service on the Company's England-Australia run until scrapped in 1952. The photo can be approximately dated as late 1931 by the fact that it shows the Sydney Harbour Bridge pylons as incomplete: they reached full height in January 1932.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/39967544@N00] Thanks Fred! Our records have been updated with this information :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I think it might be 26 January 1931, Anniversary Day (now known as Australia Day). R.M.S. 'Ormonde' was the Flagship. Read all about it - SMH 27/01/1931 p.9 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16749101 Illustration - (p.12) - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16748970
